summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing the preparation and distribution of victim notification letters in the Epstein case. It involves coordinating an updated victim list, verifying contact information with the FBI, and ensuring notifications are sent ahead of a court conference.

persons.name: Victim-Witness Assistant
persons.context: A staff member at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who is managing the victim notification list and coordinating the sending of letters.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who is requesting the victim list for review and verification before notifications are sent.

connections.description: They are colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, collaborating on the victim notification process for the Epstein case.

events.title: Finalization of Victim Notification Letters
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office staff finalize an updated victim list and prepare to send out notification letters to victims in the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination with FBI on Victim Contact Info
events.description: The prosecution team contacts the FBI to obtain updated contact information for several victims who were missing from the notification system.

events.title: Compilation and Correction of Victim List
events.description: The Victim-Witness Assistant sends an initial victim list pulled from the Victim Notification System (VNS), and the AUSA requests corrections and additions to the list.

locations.context: The address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, from which the correspondence originates.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively managing a victim notification list for the Epstein case in July 2019, ahead of a court conference.
The Victim Notification System (VNS) was used to track victims, but the list required corrections and updates, with some victims missing contact information.
The FBI was involved in providing updated contact information for victims to the prosecution team.
The correspondence indicates a sense of urgency to finalize and send victim notification letters quickly.
At least one victim had opted out of notifications, and several others required contact information to be obtained.
